title: 114_hr2788
content: The Act titled "S Corporation Modernization Act of 2015" is referenced in Section 1. It also mentions the amendment of the 1986 Code. Section 2 discusses the reduction of recognition period for built-in gains, which is made permanent. The recognition period for S corporations is defined as a 5-year period starting from the first taxable year as an S corporation. The amendment applies to determining the recognition period before or after January 1, 2015, but not for tax purposes. The recognition period for S corporations is a 5-year period starting from the first taxable year as an S corporation. This amendment does not apply for determining the tax imposed by section 1374 of the Internal Revenue Code for taxable years ending before a certain date. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF EXCESSIVE PASSIVE INVESTMENT INCOME AS A TERMINATION EVENT. Section 1362(d)(3) is amended to exclude taxable years after December 31, 2014. SEC. 4. MODIFICATIONS TO PASSIVE INCOME RULES. The text chunk amends section 1375(a)(2) by increasing the limit from "25 percent" to "60 percent" and makes conforming amendments to other sections. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014. SEC. 5 expands qualifying beneficiaries of an electing small business trust by amending Section 1361(c)(2)(B)(v) to exclude look-through for eligibility purposes. Effective January 1, 2015. SEC. 6 expands S Corporation eligible shareholders to include IRAs. Section 1361(c)(2)(A)(vi) is amended to include trusts that constitute individual retirement accounts under section 408(a), including Roth IRAs. Section 4975(d)(16) is amended to exempt the sale of stock held by an IRA to the individual for whom the account is established if certain conditions are met. The amendments made by this section, effective January 1, 2015, allow trusts that are individual retirement accounts to sell stock held by an IRA to the account holder under specific conditions, including a sale within 120 days of the S corporation election. No commissions or expenses should be paid in connection with the sale. SEC. 7 allows electing small business trusts to deduct charitable contributions without regard to certain limitations. SEC. 8 establishes a permanent rule for basis adjustment to stock of S corporations making charitable contributions of property. Section 1367(a)(2) is amended by removing the last sentence. The amendment applies to contributions made after December 31, 2014.
